    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int[] getColor(PApplet theApplet, int schemeNo)
      Set the color scheme to one of the preset schemes BLUE / GREEN / RED / PURPLE / YELLOW / CYAN / GREY or if you have created your own schemes following the instructions at gui4processing.lagers.org.uk/colorscheme.html then you can enter the appropriate numeric value of the scheme.
      static Color[] getJavaColor(PApplet theApplet, int schemeNo)
      Set the color scheme to one of the preset schemes BLUE / GREEN / RED / PURPLE / YELLOW / CYAN / GREY or if you have created your own schemes following the instructions at gui4processing.lagers.org.uk/colorscheme.html then you can enter the appropriate numeric value of the scheme.

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public static int[] getColor(PApplet theApplet,
             int schemeNo)
        Set the color scheme to one of the preset schemes BLUE / GREEN / RED / PURPLE / YELLOW / CYAN / GREY or if you have created your own schemes following the instructions at gui4processing.lagers.org.uk/colorscheme.html then you can enter the appropriate numeric value of the scheme.
        Parameters:
        theApplet -
        schemeNo -
        Returns:
        the color scheme based on the scheme number

      • getJavaColor

        public static Color[] getJavaColor(PApplet theApplet,
                   int schemeNo)
        Set the color scheme to one of the preset schemes BLUE / GREEN / RED / PURPLE / YELLOW / CYAN / GREY or if you have created your own schemes following the instructions at gui4processing.lagers.org.uk/colorscheme.html then you can enter the appropriate numeric value of the scheme.
        Parameters:
        theApplet -
        schemeNo -
        Returns:
        the color scheme based on the scheme number
